intro: Malouetia glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular malouetia, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with prominent glands. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Malouetia glandulifera is adapted to the humid, tropical climates of its native habitat.
